Class AddressBook

  • java.lang.Object
    • AddressBook

  • public class AddressBook
extends java.lang.Object
    Author:
    Ken

    This class represents an address book. The address book stores instances of the Entry class. Each of these instances represent an entry within the address book.

    There are two ways to add entries to the address book: The first way is to load the entries from a data file using this class' constructor that has the file's name as the argument. The second way to add entries is to use the "addEntry" method.

    To view entries, use the "search" method to search for a string. If the string is contained in any part of an entry, this would be considered a match in the search. The method will return an array of the search results, which will be copies of the Entry objects.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      AddressBook()
      This is the default constructor.
      AddressBook(java.lang.String fileName)
      This constructor initializes the address book's entries using a data file.

    • Constructor Detail

      • AddressBook

        public AddressBook()
        This is the default constructor.

      • AddressBook

        public AddressBook(java.lang.String fileName)
            throws java.io.IOException

        This constructor initializes the address book's entries using a data file. The data file shall be of JSON format. The JSON shall be a JavaScript array. The elements of the array shall be JavaScript associative arrays. Each associative array represents an entry of the address book. The key-value pairs of the associative arrays represent the attributes and values of the entries.

        Here is an example of what a JSON would look like:

        [ {"name": "Ken", "postalAddress": "", "note": "NYU student" }, {"name": "John Smith", "phoneNumber": "949-555-1234", "note": "software engineer" }, {"name": "Jane Doe", "emailAddress": "jane.doe@gmail.com" } ]

        As you can see, this JSON has three entries.

        Parameters:
        fileName - The name of the file to be loaded.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - Make sure the file name is correct.

    • Method Detail

      • addEntry

        public void addEntry(Entry entryToAdd)
        This method adds an entry to the address book's entry list.
        Parameters:
        entryToAdd - The entry desired to be added.

      • removeEntry

        public void removeEntry(int entryIndex)
        This method removes an entry from the address book. Use the "searchToGetEntryIndices" method in order to determine the index of the entry that is desired to be deleted.
        Parameters:
        entryIndex - The index of the entry desired to be removed.

      • getEntry

        public Entry getEntry(int entryIndex)
        This method gets the entry by using a direct index lookup.
        Parameters:
        entryIndex - The index of the desired entry.
        Returns:
        The entry of the corresponding index.

      • search

        public java.util.List<Entry> search(java.lang.String searchString)
        This method searches through each attribute of the entries in the address book. The search is case insensitive. The returned search result will contain the entries whose attributes have the search string.
        Parameters:
        searchString - The string to be searched
        Returns:
        An array of the entries whose attributes have the desired search string.

      • searchToGetEntries

        public java.util.List<Entry> searchToGetEntries(java.lang.String searchString)
        This is a wrapper method whose functionality is identical to the "search" method. This method has a more descriptive name than the "search" method.
        Parameters:
        searchString - The string to be searched
        Returns:
        An array of the entries whose attributes have the desired search string.

      • searchToGetEntryIndices

        public java.util.List<java.lang.Integer> searchToGetEntryIndices(java.lang.String searchString)
        This method searches through each attribute of the entries in the address book. The search is case insensitive. The returned search result will contain the indices of the entries whose attributes have the search string.
        Parameters:
        searchString - The string to be searched
        Returns:
        An array of the indices of the entries that have the desired search string.

      • saveToFile

        public void saveToFile(java.lang.String fileName)
                throws java.io.FileNotFoundException
        This method saves the entries of the address book to a file. The format of the file will be JSON. Spaces and newline characters are included in the output in order to make the JSON more readable to humans.
        Parameters:
        fileName - The name of the file to save to. Includes the file extension.
        Throws:
        java.io.FileNotFoundException - Make sure the directory to write to is accessible.

      • toString

        public java.lang.String toString()
        Generates and returns the string representation of the entries of the address book.
        Overrides:
        toString in class java.lang.Object
